Issue.creator: marcvauclairnxp
Issue.summary: sawtooth-shell docker file does not refer to the right build and is missing an apt-get install statement
Issue.description: sawtooth-shell-local | from sawtooth_cli.main import main_wrapper sawtooth-shell-local | File "/project/sawtooth-core/cli/sawtooth_cli/main.py", line 29, in sawtooth-shell-local | from sawtooth_cli.keygen import add_keygen_parser sawtooth-shell-local | File "/project/sawtooth-core/cli/sawtooth_cli/keygen.py", line 22, in sawtooth-shell-local | from sawtooth_signing import create_context sawtooth-shell-local | ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'sawtooth_signing' sawtooth-shell-local exited with code 1 I have trace back the issue to the absence of the installation of python3-sawtooth-sdk in the docker/sawtooth-shell docker file. I fixed it temporarily by replacing in docker/sawtooth-shell: RUN echo "deb http://repo.sawtooth.me/ubuntu/ci bionic universe" >> /etc/apt/sources.list \ && (apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80 --recv-keys 8AA7AF1F1091A5FD \ || apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://p80.pool.sks-keyservers.net:80 --recv-keys 8AA7AF1F1091A5FD) \ && apt-get update by (as found in the validator/DockerFile): RUN echo "deb http://repo.sawtooth.me/ubuntu/nightly bionic universe" >> /etc/apt/sources.list \ && (apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80 --recv-keys 44FC67F19B2466EA \ || apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://p80.pool.sks-keyservers.net:80 --recv-keys 44FC67F19B2466EA) \ && apt-get update and by adding: RUN apt-get install -y -q \ python3-sawtooth-sdk While investigating the issue I also found that: validator/DockerFile, rest_api/Dockerfile, cli/Dockerfile depend on the 44FC key while docker/sawtooth-shell, docker/sawtooth-av depend on the 8AA7 key >
